cleaned_text: Cushing's SyndromeHigh-Dose Dexamethasone Suppression Protocol For Determination of Pituitary-Dependent Tumor Cushing's Syndrome Low-dose dexamethasone suppression or stimulation results consistent Cushing's syndrome Draw 4-hour cortisol. Perform a high-dose dexamethasone suppression test with 0.1 mg/kg of dexamethasone IV . Draw baseline 4 hours <1.5 µg/dL or <50% of baseline Further testing required to differentiate PDH from ATH. Consider measuring plasma ACTH levels and/or performing an abdominal ultrasound.
